article.text: <!-- google_ad_section_start(name=story_introduction, weight=high) --> At least 12 people died across Syria, including a guard gunned down after a large explosion outside Baath party offices in Aleppo yesterday evening, hours after the suicide bombing was reportedly thwarted in the northern city."The blast was powerful but we do not know what was the origin," said Rami Abdel Rahman of the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights. "We can confirm one death - the guard of the Baath party office"An opposition activist on the ground in Aleppo, Syria's second-largest city, told AFP the blast happened near a park which regime forces had emptied out of before it went off around 8.45pm on Friday (4.45am AEST today).The activist, Mohammed al-Halabi, added however that there was a chance the explosion was caused by a sound bomb. You can now save articles on our site to read later. View more great holiday deals on Wego A flower bouquet makes a good last minute gift. Checkout out more gift ideas for Mother's Day on Getprice.com.au MODELLING says battling families will be better off post-Budget, but polling reveals half of them simply don't believe it AN Australian has been accused of murdering his former New Zealand girlfriend, who was recovering from breast cancer. APPLE co-founder says products so good, customers will never get sick of them. Oh, and Windows PCs suck. IT'S the vocal match made in TV heaven - Prince could send The Voice's powerhouse ratings soaring higher if producers nail negotiations for the royal rocker to guest on the show during his Australian tour. SECURITY forces open fire as tens of thousands of protesters take on Syrian regime, amid growing calls to arm the rebels. ALLISON Baden-Clay's grieving family say she deserves justice, but urge people not to waste energy hating her killer. FEDERAL MP Craig Thomson goes on national TV in an attempt to convince the public he was set up by a union "enemy". ENTREPRENEUR says foreign retail giants Aldi and Costco are pushing local producers out of business. MAN comes forward to claim $25m Lotto prize. It was his first game. Cue: anger. TWO people charged with extortion after detectives arrest pair for trying to sell 'embarrassing' information about Stevie Wonder. IT may be best known for its Great Wall, but China is also home to some of the most impressive limestone caves in the world.
